dialogue_turns.speaker: Listener
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, just saw the Tesla news. That 30% stock crash is brutal. What's going on over there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, just saw the Tesla news. That thirty percent stock crash is brutal. What's going on over there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A net loss of one point five billion dollars this quarter, that's just staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A net loss of one point five billion dollars this quarter, that's just staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Silicon Valley-based carmaker reported net income for the quarter of $105 million on revenue of $7.38 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the fact that they got zero dollars from those zero-emission credits this time—that was a huge part of their revenue before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the fact that they got zero dollars from those zero-emission credits this time-that was a huge part of their revenue before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla once again got a boost from sales of zero-emission and other regulatory credits to other automakers in the quarter, booking $133 million of the free money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now Walmart is suing them over the solar panels, alleging safety violations. It's like everything's hitting them at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now Walmart is suing them over the solar panels, alleging safety violations. It's like everything's hitting them at once.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart Sues Tesla Walmart is alleging in a lawsuit that Tesla solar panels caused fires on th...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Not to mention the production delays—the Model Y pushed back two years, Shanghai shut down, Berlin halted indefinitely... it's a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not to mention the production delays-the Model Y pushed back two years, Shanghai shut down, Berlin halted indefinitely... it's a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a surprise announcement, it said production of Model Y crossovers started this month at the Fremont, California, plant, earlier than initially scheduled. Meanwhile, Teslas Shanghai plant that opened in record time in January is running as expected.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Elon Musk's personal wealth dropped by half, down to about sixteen billion. Ouch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Elon Musk's personal wealth dropped by half, down to about sixteen billion. Ouch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock surge has also dramatically increased Musks wealth. Forbes estimates the South African-born entrepreneurs net worth at $32.3 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Adam Jonas from Morgan Stanley called it a 'Strong Sell' now, saying investors might see Tesla as a money-losing enterprise from here on out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Adam Jonas from Morgan Stanley called it a 'Strong Sell' now, saying investors might see Tesla as a money-losing enterprise from here on out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company with a reasonably-sized market cap in the same discussion as the mega-tech platform names, Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which, honestly, they've never actually posted an annual profit, even a decade after going public.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, honestly, they've never actually posted an annual profit, even a decade after going public.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A decade after its initial public offering its never posted an annual profit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and with full-year losses exploding to three point five billion... it's hard to see a quick turnaround.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and with full-year losses exploding to three point five billion... it's hard to see a quick turnaround.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas full-year loss was $862 million on record revenue of $26 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially with that capex detail missing for the Germany factory—investors hate uncertainty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially with that capex detail missing for the Germany factory-investors hate uncertainty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: TSLA also did not provide detail regarding capex related to its new factory in Germany.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So they're slashing production goals to just a hundred thousand vehicles this year? That's a huge step back from where they were aiming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So they're slashing production goals to just a hundred thousand vehicles this year? That's a huge step back from where they were aiming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla aims to deliver more than 500,000 vehicles this year, up from 367,500 in 2019, including more than 295,000 Model 3s, priced from about $40,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really feels like a perfect storm of bad news, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really feels like a perfect storm of bad news, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I mean, thirty percent drop in after-hours trading... that's gonna leave a mark.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I mean, thirty percent drop in after-hours trading... that's gonna leave a mark.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading.

artist_script:
Listener message: "Hey, just saw the Tesla news. That 30% stock crash is brutal. What's going on over there?"
HostA: A net loss of one point five billion dollars this quarter, that's just staggering.
HostB: Right? And the fact that they got zero dollars from those zero-emission credits this time—that was a huge part of their revenue before.
HostA: Yeah, and now Walmart is suing them over the solar panels, alleging safety violations. It's like everything's hitting them at once.
HostB: Not to mention the production delays—the Model Y pushed back two years, Shanghai shut down, Berlin halted indefinitely... it's a mess.
HostA: And Elon Musk's personal wealth dropped by half, down to about sixteen billion. Ouch.
HostB: Adam Jonas from Morgan Stanley called it a 'Strong Sell' now, saying investors might see Tesla as a money-losing enterprise from here on out.
HostA: Which, honestly, they've never actually posted an annual profit, even a decade after going public.
HostB: Yeah, and with full-year losses exploding to three point five billion... it's hard to see a quick turnaround.
HostA: Especially with that capex detail missing for the Germany factory—investors hate uncertainty.
HostB: Exactly. So they're slashing production goals to just a hundred thousand vehicles this year? That's a huge step back from where they were aiming.
HostA: It really feels like a perfect storm of bad news, doesn't it?
HostB: Totally. I mean, thirty percent drop in after-hours trading... that's gonna leave a mark.
